critique: This executive order cancels a previous order and adds land to the Moapa River Indian Reservation. It also protects any prior valid rights to the lands described. It is difficult to assess the ideological tilt without more context, but setting aside land for a reservation suggests a degree of social inclusion. The order appears to expand federal control over land, impacting federalism. There's no clear indication of impact on immigration, executive power, national security vs. civil liberties, or economic regulation.
